articles.title: National Meeting Marks May Day
articles.content:
National Meeting Marks May Day
 Pyongyang, May 1 (KCNA) -- A national meeting on the 121st May Day took place at the Namhung Youth Chemical Complex in Anju, South Phyongan Province Sunday.
					 Present there were Choe Yong Rim, Yang Hyong Sop, officials of party and power bodies and working people's organizations, officials concerned, men of meritorious service, labor innovators and working people in the province.
					
					 Choe Yong Rim, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea and premier of the Cabinet, in his report said that the working people of the DPRK greeting May Day are extending militant greetings and firm solidarity to the working people the world over dynamically struggling under the uplifted banner of justice, peace and independence against imperialism.
					
					 He said that President Kim Il Sung founded the immortal Juche idea, put forward the working people including workers, farmers and intellectuals as the masters of their destiny and led the revolution and construction to a shining victory by enlisting their inexhaustible strength.
					
					The cause of the President who put forward the working people as the masters of the country and revolution and led the revolution and construction to victory by dint of their creative ingenuity and concerted efforts is being successfully carried forward and developed by General Secretary Kim Jong Il, he noted.
					
					 Kim Jong Il has closely rallied the workers and other broad masses around the WPK with his politics of love and trust and benevolent politics and led to victory the popular masses' cause of independence, the socialist cause with the might of single-minded unity, he said.
					
					 He pointed out that the working people have glorified the exciting annals of the Korean revolution with shining victories and feats under the wise leadership of the party and the leader.
					
					 He stressed the need to cherish the faith of Juche and strong national self-esteem, maintain the revolutionary principle, the class principle, resolutely shatter the vicious ideological and cultural poisoning of the imperialists and further strengthen the political and ideological might of the Korean revolution.
					
					 He also called for pushing forward the production drive and bringing about a decisive turn in improving the standard of people's living and building a thriving nation.
					
					 He extended positive support to the just struggle of the south Korean working people for independence against the U.S. and for democratization of society and national reunification in name of all the working people.
					
					 The reporter said that the working people of the DPRK will fully discharge their historic mission in defending world peace and security and pushing ahead with the human cause of independence. They should further strengthen solidarity with the working people all over the world aspiring after independence under the uplifted banner of independence, peace and friendship, the reporter added.

articles.title: May Day Marked in DPRK
articles.content:
May Day Marked in DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 1 (KCNA) -- Senior party and state officials significantly observed the 121st May Day with working people across the country.
					 Kim Yong Nam, Choe Yong Rim, Yang Hyong Sop and other senior party and state officials and officials of the Cabinet, ministries, national institutions, and local party and power bodies and working people's organizations went to the Pyongyang Thermal Power Complex, the Namhung Youth Chemical Complex, the Hwanghae Iron and Steel Complex, the Taean Heavy Machine Complex, the Migok Cooperative Farm in Sariwon City and other organs and industrial establishments and farms to congratulate the workers, agricultural workers and intellectuals on the day.
					
					 They laid bouquets before the statues of President Kim Il Sung, portraits of the smiling President and mosaics bearing the images of the peerlessly great persons.
					
					 They went round revolutionary museums showcasing the undying leadership history of the peerlessly great persons and rooms dedicated to history of relevant units.
					
					 They met and conversed with labor innovators who are performing feats in the drive to effect a great surge.
					
					 They joined working people playing colorful sports and amusement games such as tug-of-war, Korean chess and Yut game and enjoyed art performances.
					
					 They expressed belief that all the working people would make great innovations and great leap forward in the production, construction and scientific researches and thus make tangible contributions to improving the standard of people's living and building an economic power.

articles.title: National Art Troupes Give Performances on May Day
articles.content:
National Art Troupes Give Performances on May Day
 Pyongyang, May 1 (KCNA) -- Performances were given by artistes of national art troupes at different parts of Pyongyang on Sunday, May Day.
					 The artistes of the Phibada Opera Troupe gave a performance at the park of the Mangyongdae Fun Fair.
					
					Performance started with mixed chorus "May, Month of Victory". Colorful numbers included female solo and female group dance.
					
					The performers sang of the undying feats President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il performed by building Korean-style socialist system centered on the popular masses on this land, where the working people have become masters of the country and the revolution to enjoy a worthwhile life.
					
					 The artistes of the State Folk Art Troupe gave a performance at the Rungrado Recreation Ground.
					
					 The spectators added to the festive mood, singing and dancing with performers to the tune of joyful rhythms full of national flavor.
					
					 Artistes of the Pyongyang Circus presented at the plaza of the Arch of Triumph acrobatic pieces showing witty skills to the delight of working people on the holiday.

articles.title: Workers Meeting for Reunification Held in DPRK
articles.content:
Workers Meeting for Reunification Held in DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 1 (KCNA) -- A workers meeting for reunification was held at the Rungrado Recreation Ground Sunday on the occasion of the international holiday of the workers the world over. It was to mark the 121st May Day for implementing the June 15 joint declaration and achieving peace on the Korean Peninsula according to the agreement between workers organizations of the north and the south.
					 Present there were officials of the C.C., the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea and working people.
					
					 A Korean Peninsula flag was hoisted amid the playing of song "We Are One".
					
					 A report by Hong Kwang Hyo, vice-chairman of the Reunification Committee of the C.C., the Federation, was followed by speeches.
					
					 The reporter and speakers underlined the need to wage a dynamic reunification movement by the concerted efforts of the workers in the north and the south while resolutely shattering the moves of the separatists at home and abroad.
					
					 They extended full support to the just struggle of the working people in the south to achieve independence against the U.S. and realize democratization of society and defend the right of the workers.
					
					 Then a joint resolution agreed between the north-south workers organizations was published on May Day.
					
					 It denounced the separatists for blocking the said meeting and viciously seeking the escalated confrontation with fellow countrymen.
					
					 It underscored the need to thoroughly implement the historic June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration.
					
					 The workers in the north and the south should strongly reject all the anti-reunification acts and conduct positive activities to defend peace, it stressed.
					
					 It underlined the need to strengthen solidarity and alliance with political parties, organizations and officials supporting the north-south joint declarations.

articles.title: Working People of DPRK Mark May Day
articles.content:
Working People of DPRK Mark May Day
 Pyongyang, May 1 (KCNA) -- Working people of the DPRK significantly marked May Day.
					 Industrial establishments, cooperative farms, parks and recreation grounds in Pyongyang and local areas were crowded with holiday-makers.
					
					 Those in Pyongyang played sports and amusement games and presented dances and art performances at picturesque recreation grounds of Rungra Islet, Moran Hill, Mt. Taesong and other places.
					
					 Working people in Chongjin, Hamhung, Hyesan, Kanggye, Sariwon and other places spent a joyful holiday.
					
					 The workers of the Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex and the Ryongsong Machine Complex played amusement games confident of greater leap forward.
					
					 Art performances were given and football, volleyball, basketball, tug-of-war and Korean wrestling were played at the February 8 Vinalon Complex, the Musan Mining Complex, the Kaechon Area Coal Mining Complex, the Rakwon Machine Complex, the Susongchon Combined Foodstuff Factory, the Kaesong Aeguk Garment Factory, the Kanggye Koryo Medicine Factory and other places.
					
					 Singing and laughter of the working people could be heard in Taehongdan, Phyongwon, Ryongchon, Jaeryong and Hamju counties.
					
					 Working people there presented cheerful dancing stages including peasant dance and held competitive shows of national dishes.
					
					 Intellectuals of various units including the State Academy of Sciences celebrated May Day with colorful sports and cultural events.

articles.title: Glorifying History of Heroic Struggle Called for
articles.content:
Glorifying History of Heroic Struggle Called for
 Pyongyang, May 1 (KCNA) -- Newspapers in editorials dedicated to May Day call on all the working people to add shine to the history and tradition of the heroic struggle and demonstrate the spirit of Songun Korea making leaping progress true to the leadership of the great Workers' Party of Korea.
					 Rodong Sinmun says that the working people of the DPRK have recorded history with dignity under the guidance of the great leader and party.
					
					 President Kim Il Sung established a Juche-oriented viewpoint on the workers, farmers, intellectuals and other working people from the early days of the revolution and inspired them to take part in advancing the revolution and construction, the paper says, adding:
					
					General Secretary Kim Jong Il is a great teacher and benefactor who has brought up all the working people to be ardent patriots and creators of heroic feats.
					
					 Thanks to the guidance of the great leaders, the workers, farmers and intellectuals of the DPRK have grown up to be genuine socialist workers true to the cause of the party and brought about epochal changes in building a thriving nation.
					
					 Every gain of the Korean revolution is associated with the blood and sweat shed by all the working people who have given play to the total dedication and popular heroism for the prosperity of the country.
					
					 The paper calls on all the working people to glorify the ongoing all-out advance for realizing the lifelong desire of the President with intense loyalty.
					
					 It also calls on them to tackle all projects in the revolutionary solider spirit, temperament and mettle with ardent patriotism and bring about leaping progress on all fronts upholding the WPK's idea of pushing back the frontiers of the latest science and technology.
					
					 It underlines the need for them to constantly strengthen the solidarity with the world progressive people aspiring after justice, peace and independence against imperialism in the future, too.
					
					 Minju Joson says that all the working people should conduct an all-out offensive and make breakthrough to realize the President's desire for a thriving nation and thus commemorate the centenary of birth of the President as the greatest holiday of Kim Il Sung's nation and a great auspicious holiday in human history.

articles.title: Concrete Tamping of Ryongrim Dam
articles.content:
Concrete Tamping of Ryongrim Dam
 Pyongyang, May 1 (KCNA) -- The concrete tamping of the Ryongrim dam at the Huichon Power Station has been completed in a matter of more than 700 days. 
					 The huge project which would have taken more than 10 years at an ordinary pace has been completed in the main in a matter of just two years thanks to the heroic drive of soldier-builders of the Korean People's Army who broke the ground in April, 2009. As a result, there appeared a huge dam of eternal value on the upper reaches of the Jangja River flowing between high mountains. 
					
					 They wound up the project to build a temporary drainageway in July, three months after the ground-breaking, which would have taken two years at an ordinary pace, in the wake of their successful completion of the project to build a cofferdam.
					
					 The dam ground digging and the ground concrete tamping were pushed forward simultaneously, making it possible to finish in a matter of just five months the amount of work to be done for several years and bringing the construction of the temporary drainageway and the dam ground digging to completion. This was a miraculous success unprecedented in the history of hydropower station construction.  
					
					General Secretary Kim Jong Il visited the construction site in September, 2009 and called this high speed a new Chollima Speed, the Huichon Speed as it brought about a steady leap forward and innovations and a world-startling miracle. He warmly encouraged the soldier-builders.
					
					 He visited the construction site four times in 2010, leading the KPA to take the lead in the great drive for building a thriving nation and clearly indicating the road for them to follow. 
					
					 The soldier-builders introduced an efficient method of concrete tamping through a high-pitched drive for mechanization and a three-dimensional campaign, opening a prospect for winding up the dam project in the shortest possible period.
					
					 They carried out the concrete tamping on the main part of the dam and the project to excavate bedrock on the left and right sides of the dam simultaneously and introduced drilling and blasting methods suited to different kinds of rock and conducted a competition, increasing the amount of excavated bedrock 10 times.
					
					 Concrete tamping was done in the entire length of the dam and work made rapid progress on the left and right sides of the dam and in its central part simultaneously. This resulted in bringing about such unprecedented success as tamping more than 10,000 cubic meters of concrete a day.
					
					 80 percent of concrete tamping of the dam was done in a matter of little over one and half years from the ground-breaking and such projects as the building of a bridge beam of a spillway, an emergency sluice gate, a frame of logs and the road extension made rapid progress at their final phase.
					
					 This has opened a bright prospect for completing the construction of the Huichon Power Station by 2012, the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Homage Paid to Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Homage Paid to Kim Il Sung
 Pyongyang, May 1 (KCNA) -- Foreign guests Sunday visited the Kumsusan Memorial Palace to pay homage to President Kim Il Sung. They included a delegation of the Socialist Party of Romania led by Chairman of its Supreme Council Vasile Orleanu, and Frank Engel, member of the European Parliament from the Christian Social People's Party of Luxembourg.
					 They made a bow to the President in humble reverence.
					
					 They wrote in the visitor's book.

articles.title: Korea Affected by Sandy Dust
articles.content:
Korea Affected by Sandy Dust
 Pyongyang, May 1 (KCNA) -- Sandy dust was observed in various parts of the country.
					 Yellow storm that raged in Kobi Desert, inner Mongolia and highland regions of China began affecting most areas of Korea from the Saturday evening.
					
					 A weak sandy dust was observed in different parts including west coast and inner areas in the northern part as of 9 a.m. Sunday.
					
					 The dust storm is predicted to be stronger from noon. Its concentration level is 500? per a cubic meter.
					
					 The sandy dust occurred three times so far this year.

articles.title: S. Koreans Protest against Expansion of Air Force Firing Range
articles.content:
S. Koreans Protest against Expansion of Air Force Firing Range
 Pyongyang, May 1 (KCNA) -- More than 10,000 inhabitants in Ryoju County, Kyonggi Province of south Korea held a rally on April 28 against the puppet warmongers' moves to expand air force firing range.
					 They charged that the life of inhabitants in Paeksok-ri, Rungso-myon, Ryoju County has been ruthlessly trampled down for over 50 years since the air force firing range appeared there. 
					
					 They disclosed that frequent military exercises caused huge damage including death of inhabitants in surrounding areas, destruction of schools and dwelling houses and massive death of domestic animals. 
					
					 They accused the military authorities of mulling seizing millions of square meters of more land as part of the firing range expansion plan, far from making apology to the inhabitants in Ryoju County and compensating them for the damage. 
					
					 They demanded that the military authorities immediately cancel the expansion moves.

articles.title: US to Let Its Nuclear Submarine Call at S. Korean Port
articles.content:
US to Let Its Nuclear Submarine Call at S. Korean Port
 Pyongyang, May 1 (KCNA) -- Michigan, a nuclear submarine belonging to the U.S. 7th Fleet, will enter Pusan Port of south Korea, according to south Korean CBS on April 29. 
					 The warmongers are going to open to the public the inside structure of the sub equipped with more than 150 Tomahawk cruise missiles. 
					
					 The U.S. imperialists are introducing nuclear war means to south Korea one after another against the Korean nation's desire for peaceful reunification, instigating the puppet forces to escalate confrontation with the DPRK.

articles.title: S. Korean Governor on Inter-Korean Relations
articles.content:
S. Korean Governor on Inter-Korean Relations
 Pyongyang, May 1 (KCNA) -- Choe Mun Son upon his election as governor of south Korean Kangwon Province held a press conference on April 28 in which he called for improving the inter-Korean relations, according to the south Korean Kyunghyang Daily News.
					 Saying that the improvement of the south-north relations is the most urgent issue for Kangwon Province at present, he strongly demanded the "government" resume the tour of Mt. Kumgang.

articles.title: KPA's Birthday Celebrated Abroad
articles.content:
KPA's Birthday Celebrated Abroad
 Pyongyang, May 1 (KCNA) -- Events were held in various countries between April 19 to 23 on the occasion of the 79th birthday of the Korean People's Army.
					 They included lectures in Sweden and Democratic Congo and reading sessions and film shows in Ethiopia and Russia. 
					
					 Present there were personages of the Communist Party of Sweden, the Swedish Group for the Study of the Juche Idea, the Sweden-Korea Friendship Association, the Group for the Study of            Kim Jong Il Juche Idea of Democratic Congo, a branch of the Ethiopian Youth Study Group of the Juche Idea and a company of Russia and the masses in those countries. 
					
					 The chief of the Swedish Group for the Study of the Juche Idea said that the KPA won a brilliant victory in the two revolutionary wars and firmly guaranteed the country's security and socialist construction by force of arms, meeting every provocation of the imperialists. The KPA has recorded only victories led by the peerlessly brilliant commanders, he stressed. 
					
					 He added that under the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il the KPA has grown to be transparent follower and reliable defender of socialism and become soldiers on outpost duty making breakthrough of leaping progress and advance in economic construction. 
					
					 The chairman of the Group for the Study of Kim Jong Il Juche Idea of Democratic Congo praised President Kim Il Sung as the invincible and iron-willed commander who founded the Juche idea, the Songun idea soon after he embarked on the road of revolution and led the great anti-Japanese war and the Fatherland Liberation War to victory. 
					
					 Films shown included Korean films "Fireworks for a Thriving Nation" and "Replay of Korea".

articles.title: KPA Admired by British Organizations
articles.content:
KPA Admired by British Organizations
 Pyongyang, May 1 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy and the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea issued a joint statement on April 25, the 79th birthday of the heroic Korean People's Army. 
					 The statement said:
					
					 The KPA has its roots in the Anti-Japanese People's Guerrilla Army founded in 1932 by President Kim Il Sung, the gifted strategist and invincible and iron-willed commander.
					
					 Kim Il Sung defeated Japanese imperialism with his exquisite tactics and far-sighted stratagem.    
					
					 The KPA which inherited the anti-Japanese war traditions under his leadership dealt telling defeat to U.S. imperialism in the Fatherland Liberation War and foiled such ceaseless provocations by the U.S. imperialists as the "Pueblo" incident, large spy plane "EC-121" incident and the Panmunjom incident in the subsequent period.
					
					 The KPA has grown to be a-match-for-a hundred steel-strong ranks under the care of Kim Il Sung. 
					
					 It is the genuine revolutionary armed forces of Juche and the army of the party and the leader. 
					
					 Under the Songun leadership of Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il the KPA has gained bigger successes and grown to be the invincible forces. 
					
					 It is firmly defending Korean-style socialism and the world peace.

articles.title: Mexican Organization Lauds DPRK
articles.content:
Mexican Organization Lauds DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 1 (KCNA) -- The Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism released the 55th issue of its bulletin titled "Korea's Mode of Building Thriving Nation Seen through One Slogan."
					 The article said:
					
					 The slogan "Plant your feet firmly on your land and look at the world!" represents the firm will of the Korean people to build a thriving nation their own way, holding fast to the banner of the Juche idea. 
					
					 The Korean people have made a dynamic drive for the prosperity of the country and nation with a transparent faith and will that they are masters of their own destiny and they have the strength of carving it out.
					
					 The slogan also represents the ardent desire of the Korean people to push back the frontiers of the latest science and technology as required by the IT age and scale the high eminence of a thriving nation as early as possible. 
					
					 The Korean people have the strength to head for the world with dignity. 
					
					 They have the Workers' Party of Korea which has led them to victory for more than 60 years. They also have the strong military capacity which no formidable imperialist enemy dares provoke and the inexhaustible potentials of independent national economy which they have built for decades.  
					
					 The Korean people face manifold difficulties and hardships due to the evermore undisguised obstructive moves of the U.S. and other imperialist allied forces who are displeased with the DPRK's building of a thriving nation. However, they are full of confidence and optimism about sure victory. 
					
					 It is because leader Kim Jong Il leads the drive for building a thriving nation.

articles.title: Finnish Personage Praises Kim Jong Il's Feat
articles.content:
Finnish Personage Praises Kim Jong Il's Feat
 Pyongyang, May 1 (KCNA) -- Antti Sika Aho, chairman of the Finland-Korea Society, issued a statement on April 24 on the occasion of the 79th birthday of the Korean People's Army. 
					The statement said that under the wise leadership of General Secretary Kim Jong Il the KPA has become the main force of socialist construction.
					
					 President Kim Il Sung clarified the position of the army and an important role played by it in the revolutionary struggle long ago, the statement said, adding that the DPRK's history is the history of the victorious Songun revolution. 
					
					 Thanks to the Songun politics pursued by Kim Jong Il the KPA has firmly defended socialist system and reliably defended peace on the Korean Peninsula in any adversity, said the statement.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 Thanks to the wise Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il the KPA has firmly defended the peace and stability not only on the Korean Peninsula but in the rest of the world despite the imperialists' persistent military pressure. The world progressive people fully support his Songun politics.
					
					 Under his Songun leadership the army and people of the DPRK will surely build a thriving socialist nation and achieve the country's independent and peaceful reunification.

articles.title: Indonesian Party Hopes to Develop Relations with WPK
articles.content:
Indonesian Party Hopes to Develop Relations with WPK
Pyongyang, May 1 (KCNA) -- I hope that the Korean people would significantly commemorate the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung and achieve a decisive victory in building a great prosperous and powerful nation under the wise leadership of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 Megawati Soekarnoputri, general chairwoman of the Central Directive Council of the Indonesian Democratic Party of Struggle, said this on April 26 when Jong Chun Gun, DPRK ambassador to Indonesia, paid a farewell call on her. She also hoped that the north and the south of Korea would improve the relations and the six-party talks be resumed.
					
					 She stressed that her party always positively supports the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea and hopes to develop the cooperative relations with the Workers' Party of Korea.

articles.title: Nepal Organizations Condemn S. Korea's Inhuman Acts
articles.content:
Nepal Organizations Condemn S. Korea's Inhuman Acts
 Pyongyang, May 1 (KCNA) -- Nine Nepalese organizations issued a joint statement on April 26 in support of the fact-finding statement issued by the C.C., the Red Cross Society of the DPRK. They included the Committee for Supporting the Reunification of Korea, the Afro-Asian People's Solidarity Committee, the Journalist Association, the Study Forum for Self-Reliance and the Association for Supporting the Songun Politics.
					 The statement condemned the thrice-cursed inhuman acts perpetrated by the south Korean authorities against the DPRK citizens.
					
					 It expressed concern about the tensions rising on the Korean Peninsula due to the inhuman acts committed by the south authorities.
					
					 It bitterly condemned the south authorities for seizing a boat and inhabitants of the DPRK, unreasonably detaining them and conducting an operation to force them to "defect" to the south and finally not sending some of them back to the north.
					
					 These are treacherous and anti-reunification acts aimed to scuttle the north-south dialogue, chill the atmosphere of improving the north-south relations and stoke confrontation between fellow countrymen, the statement said. 
					
					 The south Korean authorities should opt for national reconciliation and unity, not trying to find a way out in making such provocations, it added.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary Commemorated
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary Commemorated
 Pyongyang, May 1 (KCNA) -- The birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung was commemorated in the DPRK missions in foreign countries and regions. They included those in Cambodia, Syria, Iran, India, Indonesia, Myanmar, the Czech Republic, Britain, Switzerland, France, Peru, Shenyang and Hong Kong of China and Nakhodka of Russia, the DPRK permanent mission at the UN Office in Geneva and international organizations and the DPRK permanent mission at the UN. Events held between March 31 and April 14 included receptions, meetings, book and photo exhibitions and film shows.
					 Displayed in the venues were books and photos introducing the revolutionary life of the President and the Songun leadership exploits of Kim Jong Il and photos showing the struggle of the Korean people in building a great prosperous and powerful nation.
					
					 Films shown included Korean films "For Liberation of the Country", "The Arch of Triumph" and "The Faith of Korea."
					
					 The minister of Public Works and Transport of Cambodia said that the President is the eternal leader of the DPRK who liberated Korea from the colonial rule of the Japanese imperialists, firmly defended the sovereignty of the country from the aggression by foreign forces and built an invincible socialist power.
					
					 He expressed hope that the friendly and cooperative relations between Cambodia and the DPRK provided by Great King Norodom Sihanouk and President Kim Il Sung would continue to favorably develop.
					
					 The deputy chief of the General Staff of the General Command of Armed Forces of Iran said that Kim Il Sung was a great man who wisely led the cause of global independence, adding that the Iranian people would never forget the support and encouragement he extended to them.
					
					 The vice-chairman and concurrently international secretary of the C.C., the Communist Party of Great Britain (Marxist-Leninist) said that it is great fortune of the Korean people and other world revolutionary people to hold in high esteem Kim Jong Il who is identical to the President.

articles.title: Worldwide Serious Famine
articles.content:
Worldwide Serious Famine
 Pyongyang, May 1 (KCNA) -- The increase of number of famine victims in many countries arouses serious concern. 
					 The U.N. Food and Agriculture Organization said on Tuesday that hunger affects 13 percent of the population.
					
					 Food prices hit a record high early this year.

articles.title: Palestinian Leadership Slams Israeli New Jewish Settlement Plans
articles.content:
Palestinian Leadership Slams Israeli New Jewish Settlement Plans
 Pyongyang, May 1 (KCNA) -- Saeb Erekat, a member of the Palestine Liberation Organization (PLO)'s Executive Committee, in an interview with a radio on Wednesday said that the Palestinian leadership slammed Israeli plans to build new houses in an east Kuds settlement.
					 He called for an international, mainly U.S. intervention to stop the plans of building 386 houses in east Kuds.
					
					"The continuation of settlement construction destroys all chances left for the peace process," Erekat noted. 
					
					He called upon the international community to put pressure on Israel to cancel such unreasonable plans at once.

articles.title: National Week for Vaccination Information Opens in China
articles.content:
National Week for Vaccination Information Opens in China
 Beijing, April 29 (KCNA) -- The 26th national week for vaccination information was opened in Beijing on April 25.
					 Various forms of hygienic information about important significance of vaccination in protecting the health of children will be conducted across the country on the theme "Vaccination and health of beloved children".

articles.title: China Rejects Japan's Wrong Assertion
articles.content:
China Rejects Japan's Wrong Assertion
 Beijing, April 29 (KCNA) -- A press spokesperson for the Ministry of Defense of China, strongly rejected Japan's wrong stand against China at a press conference on April 27. 
					 He clarified China's resolute opposition to Japan disregarding the objective reality in China which keeps to the path of peaceful development and pursues national defence policy. He also blamed Japan for hyping up the "military threat from China."
					
					 As for the test flight of stealth fighter "J-20", he said that the development of armed equipment of the Chinese army is not targeted against any country and specific aim, adding that the outside world should refrain from excessive assumption and interpretation about China's test of armed equipment.

articles.title: Russia Plans to Develop New-type Tank
articles.content:
Russia Plans to Develop New-type Tank
 Moscow, April 29 (KCNA) -- Russia recently drafted a plan to develop new-type tank "Armada" and is pushing ahead with it.
					 The tank to be equipped with sophisticated automatic devices will be able to fire while moving and will use new ammunition.
					
					 The tanks are to be deployed from 2015, said an official concerned of the Russian Ministry of Defence Thursday.

articles.title: Reexamination of Agreement on Position of US Forces in Japan Urged
articles.content:
Reexamination of Agreement on Position of US Forces in Japan Urged
 Pyongyang, May 1 (KCNA) -- The Okinawa Prefectural Assembly, Japan adopted on Monday a resolution and a written opinion requesting the reexamination of the agreement on position of the U.S. forces in Japan.
					 A civilian worker of the U.S. forces who caused a traffic accident in the prefecture recently that led to the loss of life received no punishment by law. Strongly protesting the impunity, the documents underscored the need to reexamine the agreement.

articles.title: Russian President on Providing Youth with Working Condition
articles.content:
Russian President on Providing Youth with Working Condition
 Moscow, April 29 (KCNA) -- Russian President Dmitri Medvedev in an interview with a TV radio on Monday stressed the need to provide the youth with normal working condition.
					 The government should make efforts to provide young people with normal working condition, he said, adding this work is needed for the state.

articles.title: Ex-contractor Chief Testifies to Giving Slush Funds to Ozawa Aides
articles.content:
Ex-contractor Chief Testifies to Giving Slush Funds to Ozawa Aides
 Pyongyang, May 1 (KCNA) -- A former president of Mizutani Construction Co. told a court Wednesday that he gave 100 million yen in slush funds to the two aides of Ichiro Ozawa, former representative of the Japanese Democratic Party.
					 Following the disclosure the chairman of the Policy Council of the group of the House of Councillors of the Liberal Democratic Party of Japan indicated at a press conference that he would seriously deal with this issue at the National Assembly council.

articles.title: AL Praises Palestinian National Reconciliation Agreement
articles.content:
AL Praises Palestinian National Reconciliation Agreement
 Pyongyang, May 1 (KCNA) -- The Arab League (AL) hailed on Thursday the initial reconciliation agreement signed by Palestinian rival groups Hamas and Fatah on the controversial points in Cairo.
					 The AL called to mobilize all Arab and Palestinian efforts in order to transform this agreement into real ground and to start implementation immediately.

articles.title: Fiji Refutes UN Report on Alleviation of Poverty
articles.content:
Fiji Refutes UN Report on Alleviation of Poverty
 Pyongyang, May 1 (KCNA) -- The Fijian government on Thursday refuted a report issued by the United Nations Peak Development Agency stating that Fiji is not doing enough to alleviate the rise of poverty in the island nation.
					 In response to the UN report, a Fiji official said that the Fiji government has allocated a lot of money and done all efforts to enhance the alleviation of poverty in the country.

articles.title: Soaring Food Prices Threaten Millions of Asians
articles.content:
Soaring Food Prices Threaten Millions of Asians
 Pyongyang, May 1 (KCNA) -- Resurgent global food prices, which posted record increases in the first two months of 2011, are again threatening to push millions of people in developing Asia into extreme poverty, the Asian Development Bank (ADB) said in a report Tuesday.
